attributes.action: Amend the Stamp Duty to a sliding scale as with Income Tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: For families to afford a family home they invariably need to spend more than £250,000 this puts them over 1% stamp duty threshold. We believe the stamp duty charged should be on a sliding scale as with Income Tax. This would mean zero stamp duty on the first £150,000, 1% on £150,000 to £250,000, 3% on £250,000 to £500,000 then 4% for anything over £500,000. With the increase in house prices (the average house price is now over £200,000) in the last decade this sliding scale system would be a fairer policy for collecting stamp duty.
